intro: Klasea tanaitica, commonly known as the Tanaitic klasea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
